definition: to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: Living by faith continues with a decision to follow Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 凭信而活还要有追随耶稣的决定。

sentences.english: Besides, stamps for sealing documents and letters were inscribed with social positions and official ranks to vouch for the veracity of orders.
sentences.chinese: 印章刻有地位和官职，用于文件和书信，以为凭信。

sentences.english: Their examples encourage us to come to God in faith.
sentences.chinese: 他们的榜样激励我们凭信往神那里去。

sentences.english: O blessed Son of God, In love and faith we plead.
sentences.chinese: 天父喜悦之子，凭信与爱祈求。

sentences.english: His words are not to be trusted.
The statement of "One Pavilion Every Ten Li" in historical materials of the Qin and Han Dynasties is not true.
sentences.chinese: 秦汉史籍所谓的“十里一亭”之说是不足凭信的。

definition: to decide/to determine/established practice/(dialect) firmly resolved (to do sth)
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
to warn/to admonish/variant of 針|针[zhen1]
